Dear Mr. Derscheid:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement.
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Allegation Youth was hiding a marijuana vape pen in their underwear. Two
staff members held youth's arms and instructed youth to remove
their pants and underwear. Youth did provide the marijuana
cartridge to staff, but there are concerns that youth was made to
remove their clothing in the process.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on May 17, 2023,
and reported they had no further information.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 18,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A described
attempting to climb out his second story bedroom window and
being pulled in by Director and Staff 1. Youth A stated Director
and Staff 1 kept holding onto his arms until Youth A gave up a
vape cartridge and charger he had hid in his underwear. Youth A
said, “they had enough of me using it (vape) because I would not
give it up.” Youth A reported Director told Youth A he needed to
take his pants and underwear off or Director and Staff 1 would do
it for Youth A. Youth A said Director told Youth A, some State
lady told me we could do this. Youth A described being in the
corner of his bedroom, while Director and Staff 1 each held an end
of a towel, while also holding Youth A’s bicep area so Youth A
could take off his pants and underwear. Youth A stated Youth
Services Manager was in the room taking the clothes Youth A
removed and searched them for the vape, vape cartridge and
charger. Youth A stated Director and Staff 1 held his arms until
Youth A gave up the charger. Youth A reported he was given a
pair of boxers and was able to put them on along with his pants.
Youth A denied any other youth or staff witnessing the event.
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 18,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Director stated
because Youth A was already in a restraint, he decided to take the
opportunity to approach Youth A about the vape pen. Director
reported Youth A had showed signs of being high over the
weekend and would go into the bathroom for 10-15 minutes at a
time where he could be heard coughing. Director stated staff
believed Youth A was vaping in the bathroom but never found the
2

vape pen. Director reported when Youth A was in the restraint, he
was asked multiple times about the vape pen and was told he
would be searched for the contraband. Director stated after 20
minutes Youth A voluntarily gave up a vape wax cartridge and
charging cord.
Director reported he and Staff 1 continued to loosely hold Youth
A’s arms while Youth A removed his jeans and two pairs of
underwear. Director described holding one end of a towel while
Staff 1 held the other end of the towel as Youth A removed his
clothes. Director reported no other youth were present only Youth
Services Manager standing in the bedroom doorway for a portion
of the restraint.
Youth Services Manager (YSM) was interviewed face to face
at the facility on May 18, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS
Worker. YSM reported being called to assist with Youth A who
was trying to crawl out his bedroom window. YSM stated when he
arrived at Youth A’s bedroom, Youth A was standing with Director
and Staff 1 in a bicep assist restraint. YSM stated staff suspected
Youth A was vaping and Director communicated with YSM during
the restraint wanting to search Youth A. YSM stated the search
was warranted and conducted according to the facility’s policy.
YSM reported Youth A pulled a battery from his jean pocket and
was told staff suspected he had more items on him. YSM
described Youth A standing, facing away from YSM, while YSM
started patting down Youth A’s pant leg. YSM stated he got up to
Youth A’s heel and Youth A said, “I’ll do it.” YSM stated at that
time, Youth A did not give up any more items and YSM had to
leave the area to attend to another youth. YSM reported when he
returned to Youth A's bedroom a vape cartridge and cord was on
Youth A’s bed and Youth A was no longer in the restraint. YSM
denied having any concerns with how the search of Youth A was
conducted. YSM stated there were no other youth present when
the search took place.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 24,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 described
Youth A trying to get out a second story window. Staff 1 stated he
and Director pulled Youth A in from the window and Youth A
started to push them. Staff 1 reported Youth A was placed in a
bicep assist. Staff 1 stated Director told Staff 1 we are going to do
a search of Youth A for the vape contraband. Staff 1 reported
Youth A was in the corner of his bedroom, no other youth were
present, and Director and Staff 1 held a towel while Youth A took
off his own clothes. Staff 1 stated YSM was standing in the
3

doorway of Youth A’s bedroom but at one point left to get boxers
for Youth A to put on. Staff 1 reported Youth A pulled out a
cartridge and a charging cord from his underwear. Staff 1 stated
Youth A had two pairs of underwear on with the items between the
underwear. Staff 1 stated staff had suspicion Youth A was getting
high and had vapes on him. Staff 1 denied having concerns with
how the search was performed and stated Youth A’s decency was
always protected.
DHHS Worker has no findings in the investigation.
Documents Reviewed:
• Privacy Procedures – Searches of Youth and Property
Policy: Policy outlines any search requiring removal of
pants and/or short must be approved by a youth services
supervisor, clinical manager, Assistant Director, or Director,
there must be two male staff present and the youth’s
modesty must be ensured. Clinical Manager (YSM) and
Director approved the search, Director and Staff 1 were
with Youth A the entire time holding a towel to ensure
Youth A’s modesty.
• Incident Report: outlines what was reported in interviews
and what is allowed according to policy.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as Youth A, Director, Youth
Services Manager, and Staff 1 describe the facility’s search policy
being followed. When searching Youth A, Youth A’s modesty,
ethics, and humiliation guidelines were not violated. The search
was approved by the Director and two staff were present during
the search, Director, and Staff 1.
Consultation:
It was recommended to the facility if after accessing a youth who
has consumed drugs and agency has medical concerns the
agency seek medical attention for the youth to be evaluated. If
necessary, law enforcement should be contacted, and the youth
should be continuously monitored by staff if there is concern the
youth is actively using while at the facility.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4160 Emergency restraint.
Section (1) The use of emergency restraint as a lifesaving response for a
Description youth will be limited to:
(c) The emergency restraint must not last longer than needed to
end the threat of serious physical harm.
4

Violation Additional Finding
Type
Allegation Restraint of youth continued after youth was calmed down and no
longer a serious threat.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 18,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A described
attempting to climb out his second story bedroom window and
being pulled in by staff. Youth A stated he was sitting on the
window ledge with his back and head hanging out the window
while both of his legs were inside his bedroom. Youth A reported
Director grabbed one of Youth A’s pant legs and Staff 1 grabbed
the other pant leg and pulled Youth A back into his bedroom from
the window ledge. Youth A described a chair being near the
window so when he was pulled back in from hanging outside the
window, Director and Staff 1 had him sit in the chair. Youth A
stated Director and Staff 1 each held his arms down on the arm
rest of the chair for a moment, stood Youth A up and placed him in
a restraint. Youth A stated he was not sure if it was a restraint
because it was different than other restraints. Youth A reported
Director had his hands holding Youth A’s bicep and Staff 1 was on
the other side doing the same thing. Youth A stated he knows
restraints can only occur if he is a threat to himself or others.
Youth A denied being a threat to himself or others. Youth A stated
Director and Staff 1 kept holding onto his arms until Youth A gave
up a vape cartridge and charger he had hidden in his underwear.
Youth A described being in the corner of his bedroom, while
Director and Staff 1 each held an end of a towel, while also
holding Youth A’s bicep area so Youth A could take off his pants
and underwear. Youth A stated Director and Staff 1 held his arms
until Youth A gave up the charger, then Youth A was released
from the restraint. Youth A stated he was fighting the restraint
when he was first pulled in from the window and when he stood up
from the chair but that was the only time.
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 18,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Director described
Youth A refusing to go to school and Director being called for
assistance. Director stated when he arrived at Youth A’s
bedroom, Youth A was agitated, wandering around the bedroom,
and looking out the bedroom window. Director reported Youth A
opened the window from his second-floor bedroom, stepped on
the chair that was by the window and backed out the window.
Director described Youth A sitting on the window ledge with his
back and head hanging outside the window and Youth A’s legs
inside the window in the bedroom. Director stated Youth A was
5

becoming more agitated and was not coming back in the window
so after about 20 seconds Director and Staff 1 pulled Youth A in
from the window ledge. Director stated he grabbed one of Youth
A’s pant legs and Staff 1 grabbed the other pant leg to get Youth
A back inside the bedroom. Director stated Youth A was
struggling, moving back and forth trying to get out of the restraint.
Director reported when Youth A was brought back inside, he and
Staff 1 placed Youth A in standing restraint. Director denied
Youth A sitting in a chair holding Youth A’s arms down on the arm
rest.
Director described Youth A struggling at different times during the
restraint and making vale threats toward him and Staff 1. Director
stated he felt the restraint was warranted because Youth A just
went out the second story window, was still not calm, has a history
of walking away and Director felt at that moment it was the time to
address the vaping contraband staff believed Youth A had hidden
on him. Director stated the restraint lasted about 28 minutes.
Director reported Youth A would promise to give up the vape, then
would refuse, would say he would give it up, then refuse so
Director and Staff 1 maintained their hold on Youth A until Youth A
gave up the contraband and put boxers on. Director described
holding Youth A’s upper arm with one hand and the corner of a
towel with his other hand while Youth A removed his own clothes.
Director stated Staff 1 was holding Youth A’s other arm and the
other end of the towel.
Youth Services Manager (YSM) was interviewed face to face
at the facility on May 18, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS
Worker. YSM described seeing Youth A standing in a bicep
assist with Director and Staff 1. YSM denied seeing Youth A
sitting in a chair having his arms held by Director and Staff 1.
YSM reported Youth A was very uncooperative, making
threatening statements and flaring his arms. YSM stated when he
was in Youth A’s bedroom the first time, for about 15 minutes,
Youth A was still escalated. YSM reported when he left and came
back to Youth A’s bedroom Youth A was no longer in the restraint.
YSM could not recall how long he was gone before returning to
Youth A’s bedroom.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 24,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported
when Youth A was brought in from the window, Youth A started
pushing Director and Staff 1. Staff 1 stated Youth A was placed in
a bicep assist. Staff 1 stated he did not recall Youth A being
placed in a chair. Staff 1 described Youth A as pushing, fidgeting
6

around, and trying to move from the corner area of the bedroom.
Staff 1 reported Youth A would start to comply and act like he was
going to give up the contraband so Youth A would be released but
then Youth A would try to move from the corner area so Staff 1
and Director would hold Youth A’s arms again.
Documents reviewed:
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 154690204: Youth A was placed in a
restraint at 10:30am and released at 10:58am.
Analysis Based upon interviews Youth A was able to take his jeans and two
pairs of underwear off, retrieve a wax cartridge, charging cord and
put boxers on while Director and Staff 1 continued to hold Youth A
in a bicep assist. Youth A was not described as exhibiting serious
physical harm while doing these movements.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4163 Health status assessment; notification;
Section debriefing; reporting.
Description (5) An agency will provide an incident report on a form prescribed
by the department for each incident involving the use of seclusion
or restraint. The initial report shall be submitted to the department
within 24 hours of the incident occurring. A final incident report
shall be submitted no later than 72 hours after the incident has
occurred.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
Allegation An incident report was provided to the department nine days after
the restraint occurred.
Investigation When reviewing documentation of Youth A’s restraint, I noticed
the incident report was submitted nine days after the restraint
occurred.
Documents reviewed:
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 154690204: Date of incident 5/8/2023,
incident report submitted date 5/17/2023.
Analysis The facility is in non-compliance of the rule for submitting the
incident report nine days after the restraint occurred.
Conclusion Violation Established
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
